text: Vidyaloka College is a boys' school in Galle, Sri Lanka. The school was established on 14 January 1941 by philanthropist Henry Woodward Amarasuriya under the patronage of Venerable Weliwitiye Punyasara Thera.History of the College It is a national school which accommodates over 2800 students and provides primary and secondary education to them.Re-construction project at Vidyaloka College, Galle The school was re-constructed after it was badly affected by the Indian Ocean tsunami in 2004. == College Today == The college today provides education to about 2900 students from grade 1 to grade 13 and it is regarded as one of the leading boys' schools in the Southern Province of Sri Lanka. == School Boundaries == The land named ‘Kekiri Obada Watta’ where the school is located stretches up to the Wackwella road to the East, Vidyaloka Lane to the North, Sri Devamitta Mawatha to the West and Queens Cinema to the South and it is a flat land of about of 2 acres of extent situated in the heart of Galle city. == Past principals == * 1941 - 1944 : E. A. C. Munasinghe * 1945 - 1964 : B. D. P. de Silva * 1964 - 1965 : A. Hendravitharana * 1965 - 1971 : B. K. de Silva * 1971 - 1977 : Chandradasa de Silva * 1977 - 1981 : Christy Nanayakkara * 1981 - 1995 : D. H. Senevirathna * 1996 - 2004 : M. B. L. de Silva * 2004 - 2010 : N. G. Gunapala * 2010 - 2013 : F. Welege *2013–present : P. P. W. Senewirathna == College Houses == Students are divided into four houses according to their admission number.
